Even though I am not planning on making lecture slides in the upcoming semester, I have been meaning to learn how to find and use fonts in my visuals.

I have always loved the `Cowboy Bebop` and felt the zen of the title cards at the end of each episode, such as

![](youre_gonna_carry_that_weight.jpg)

I happened upon a [Reddit post](https://old.reddit.com/r/cowboybebop/comments/actwai/anyone_else_just_love_the_font_they_use/edarmyq/) where someone mentioned that the font is (or is very similar to) Cheltenham Condensed Bold, and I'm sure that the intended font has italics too.  Thus, I grabbed the font over at [FontGeek](https://fontsgeek.com/fonts/Cheltenham-Condensed-Bold-Italic), uploaded the `.tff` file into Canva, and made the following

![](QuoVadimus.png)

This Latin phrase is from the [series finale](https://sntranscripts.livejournal.com/11808.html) of another late 1990s TV show called `Sports Night`
